definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: The research process and performance of high drop point fiber core grease were introduced.
sentences.chinese: 简要介绍了高滴点钢丝绳麻芯脂的研制过程及其性能。

sentences.english: High-drop-point lubricating grease is one of the ways of developing new lubricating greases.
sentences.chinese: 高滴点润滑脂是润滑脂的一个发展方向。

sentences.english: Could your eyes use some drop to clear up redness?
sentences.chinese: 你的眼睛可以滴点眼药水来清除血丝吗？

definition: Yanshui town in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to skim/lightly touching the water (as the dragonfly in the idiom 蜻蜓點水|蜻蜓点水)/skin-deep
to apply (ointment, powder)/to smear/to paint on
variant of 棉籤|棉签[mian2 qian1]/cotton swab
to work extra hours/to do overtime
essential balm containing menthol, eucalyptus oil etc, used as a mosquito repellant
